sub_title: Senior Product Manager Prime at Amazon
summary: Energetic and dedicated Marketeer with strong interest in unlocking profitable growth opportunities to drive business results and improving brand preference. Driven by strong ownership, clear drive for results and pro-active attitude, I am always eager to learn fast, go out of my comfort zone easily and tackle complex business challenges through teamwork. Passionate traveler (visited +30 countries) with an endless enthusiasm to discover new places all over the world.

projects.title: Brand Management project: how to transform the brand Star in an icon in the next five years
projects.description: In the Brand Management course, we were asked from the Italian company Star to transform the brand Star into an icon in the next five years. After the market analysis of the food industry in general, we decided to start with a qualitative analysis through 24 interviews between in-depth interviews and focus groups. Thanks to that, we discovered that the brand has a positive brand image characterized by strong familiarity, Italianness and long-standing tradition. Star’s main strength is the familiar dimension, while the main weakness is a certain lack of contemporariness. For this reason, we moved on with a quantitative analysis through a survey sent to 187 Italian people from 18 to 70 years old and we found out that the brand Star is only associated with the “stock cube”. In these terms, we proposed some new strategies in order to become a modern and updated brand with new slogan “Star insieme a voi” and a new woman on the packaging of the product.

projects.title: Market research project: Nike
projects.description: In the "Market Research" course, we were asked from the company Nike to realize a complete market research of footwear industry. In particular, our focus was to analyze the aspect of the sneakers Nike from sport to fashion accessory. After an overview of the footwear market in general with the analysis of different competitors including Adidas, Puma, New Balance, Converse, Asics, Reebok, we decided to move on with a internal analysis of the brand Nike. We started with a qualitative analysis (in-depth interviews, focus group, participant observation and netnography), followed by a quantitative analysis thanks to a survey sent to 241 people from 18 to 35 years old. The data were analysed with the following analysis: univariate and bivariate analysis, factor analysis and cluster analysis, linear regression, positioning and quadrant analysis. To summarize, nowadays consumers are used to give greater importance to design and color rather than comfort, indeed, in these recent years sneakers are used outside the gym during the free time with family or friends. We decided to illustrate some strategic implications to the company, useful to improve the future brand strategies.

projects.title: The Happy Farm
projects.description: In the Product Innovation course, we were asked from Go Beyond to create a new start up company and realize its business model. First of all, thanks to a focus group of 8 people we had two potential ideas but just one was taken in consideration. Our idea was to create a digital platform with the aim of facilitating the relationship between consumers and Italian biological farmers, matching the increasing need of a more sane, genuine and sustainable alimentation. It is also possible to adopt an animal or a plant using its products and monitoring its growth. We analysed the external biological market with all trends and distinctive characteristics. Then we decided to analyse all data from the online channel with a focus on the e-commerce in the alimentary industry. At this point of the project, we presented the marketing mix with points of strength, weakness, opportunity and threat of our idea, called “The Happy Farm”. At the end, there was a detailed description of the strategy with the support of quantitative analysis for the next 3 years.

projects.title: Consumer Behavior Project - Virgin Active
projects.description: This qualitative research project investigates the target group Millennials (also called Y-Generation) in terms of behaviors and use of technology and develops a new strategy in order to attract them in the fitness world. Research insights were collected through the conduction of a Focus Group and In-Depth interviews. A final presentation of the findings and the managerial implications were given to the marketing managers of Virgin Active.

projects.title: Prénatal - Retail and Channel Marketing
projects.description:
- Analysis of the brand, the company's product lines, marketing, distribution, and communication strategies
- Competitive analysis to evaluate the price positioning and quality of clients portfolio of each competitor
- New multi-channel, multi-brand strategy (the company has always implemented the single channel, mono-brand strategy before): taking decisions regarding the assortment, in-store space management, in-store services, store location, shopping experience, personnel, and supply chain management 
- Analysis of potential opportunities and risks of the new channel implementation
- Develope a Channel Strategy in order to expand and manage the formats portfolio of the company.

profile_positions.description:
Own end-to-end the Breakfast portfolio in the Kitchen Appliances global marketing team
-	Created ambitious future portfolio strategy and innovation roadmap to generate profitable growth in collaboration with key stakeholders while collecting full buy-in from the category MT.
-	Identified new business opportunities and launched 2 new innovative propositions in 10+ markets  delivered with the highest quality standards and in a timely fashion, pioneering the first speed track project (go-to-market lead time cut from 18 to 7 months).
-	Took ownership to build propositions around sustainability in the category paving the ground for the launch of the first sustainable Breakfast set within Philips.
-	Drove growth thanks to portfolio size reduction allowing faster decisions on product life cycle management as well as quick reaction to competition’s moves.


Acquired skills: value proposition creation, project management, stakeholder management, end-to-end ownership, effective communication one-to-one and one-to-many, time management and priority setting, portfolio management, pricing, product development, team management, people management, collaboration.
profile_positions.title: Global Product Manager Kitchen Appliances

profile_positions.description:
Proud to have been part of one of the exciting and biggest innovations of Philips today, OneBlade, in the Personal Care Business Group within the upstream Marketing team in the Global HQ 

Bring the new franchise OneBlade to the global market and developing key global product launches.

Create & launch worldwide a new breakthrough innovation as part of OneBlade global marketing team
-	Contributed to the innovation roadmap by translating consumer insights into concepts. Developed the hard case and new promotional SKUs while improving OneBlade awareness contributing to the ramp–up of handles and blades sell-out.
-	Rolled-out OneBlade in 5+ geographies (e.g. EU, CEE, ANZ) in line with the plan reaching 33 markets by 2018 while adapting proposition and communication to local consumer feedback.
-	Orchestrated collaboration with key stakeholders (e.g. product and digital marketing teams, R&D team, consumer experience teams).
-	Actively contributed to the organization of the Global Proposition Introduction Meeting events reaching an overall satisfaction rating of 9.5/10.


Acquired skills: reliability, responsibility and strong ownership, time management, results driven, flexibility
profile_positions.title: Global Product Manager Personal Care | OneBlade

profile_positions.description:
Assist the Mother & Childcare global marketing team with the development of the product roadmap
-	Led end-to-end life cycle management projects including business case creation and contributed to a new product introduction in the Toddler Drinking business in priority markets. 
-	Fully ran the 2017 key project in the Toddler Drinking business by managing a design and packaging for 73 SKUs in 50+ countries & participated to the year’s biggest project in the Infant Feeding business to ensure the set-up of a bottle manufacturing unit in Varginha, Brazil.
-	Reached the Rating and Reviews full-year target thanks to the ongoing monitoring of the product performances on Philips.com and e-retailers (e.g. Amazon).


Acquired skills: product management, team play, agenda planning, organizational and communication skills, set priorities
profile_positions.title: Global Jr Product Manager Health & Wellness | Mother & Childcare

profile_positions.description:
Create media content used by the MT to position Philips as a leader in the health technology industry
-	Successfully localized the international research Future Health Index. Developed the quantitative survey and created the communication strategy. Organized the press conference and contributed to the publication of 10+ articles on the most important Italian newspapers.
-	Contributed to the Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome communications plan by driving digital activities (e.g. online survey, email campaigns). Increased syndrome awareness in Italy.
-	Created a framework to map and prioritize the most important Healthcare yearly events (e.g. RSNA) which was used as an input by relevant stakeholders to assess where to play priorities.


Acquired skills: team play, agenda planning, meetings' schedule and communication skills

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Netherlands chapter of the global Women@Amazon Affinity Group is a volunteer-run group passionate about breaking down gender discrimination to ensure Amazon Netherlands is an inclusive and equitable workplace for all employees.

Our mission is to make Amazon the best place for women to work in the Netherlands. We focus on attracting, retaining, advocating, celebrating and elevating women.

volunteer_experiences.role: Team lead of Philips Women Lead (Amsterdam chapter)
volunteer_experiences.description:
Philips Women Lead is a global movement and platform for early-career women to connect with each other and find the right resources to grow personally and professionally.

I am leading the Ambassador team of this movement in the Amsterdam site coordinating 7 people and organizing quarterly events with Philips senior leaders and external speakers based on specific themes.

company.name: Voluntary association for old age pensioners at Movimento Terza Età

volunteer_experiences.description: The association has been founded in 1972 and it has the objective of promoting life and personally developing retired people through spiritual, cultural and leisure initiatives. Meeting with these people have the objective of offering friendship and help in order to fight loneliness.

Save the Children is present at Expo with the experiential Village, a welcoming environment made out of wood and recycled materials, with landscaped outdoor areas and a garden. The design of the Village on the Expo Site takes its cue from many of the structures found in the countries in which the organization operates. Inside the Village, through interactive, digital and analogue installations offering sensorial experiences, visitors can learn about the impact of malnutrition on many children, and also about correct food practices and the crucial role played by the mother, in her close, intimate relationship with the baby and child, in ensuring adequate nutrition and care and educating him or her about proper nutritional practices. 

At the beginning of the pathway, the visitor is invited to become the twin of one of the children who benefit from the organizations’ interventions, through an installation called the birth machine.
Once the visitor has been assigned his twin, the visitor is presented with a birth bracelet, and begins a journey through the five environments of the village, where he discovers the story of the child with whom he has been matched and experiences some of his or her daily challenges. In this way he can try to imagine how his life would have been had he been born elsewhere in the world and think about what he can do personally to change the life of that child. Be the Change is indeed a "call to action" taking place in the Village!
